title: git init
description: The git init command creates a new Git repository. It converts our current working folder to a Git repository or initialize a new repository.

title: git add
description: The git add command adds a change in the working directory to the staging area. It notify Git that you want to include updates to a particular file in the next commit.

title: git commit
description: The git commit command captures a snapshot of the project's currently staged changes.

title: git clone
description: The git clone command target an existing repository and create a clone, or copy of the target repository.

title: git log --graph --abbrev-commit --decorate --format=format:'%C(bold blue)%h%C(reset) - %C(bold cyan)%aD%C(reset) %C(bold green)(%ar)%C(reset)%C(bold yellow)%d%C(reset)%n''          %C(white)%s%C(reset) %C(dim white)- %an%C(reset)' --all
description: This log command returns a pretty git log with one line colorful commit summary, and absolute commit date.

title: git diff
description: The git diff command shows the differences between files that haven't been staged yet.

title: git checkout [branch_name]
description: The git checkout command changes the current working branch to the specified branch in <branch_name> you can further pass -b if the branch is not already present.

title: git branch
description: The git branch command lists all local branches in the current repository.

title: git reset
description: Clear the files from staging area

title: git pull
description: Fetch and integrate the repository to the local repository

title: git checkout -b [branch_name]
description: This git command creates a branch with the 'branch_name' and also goes into it (checks in the newly created branch).

title: git diff
description: The git diff command shows the differences between files that haven't been staged yet.

title: git clone [url]
description: The git clone downloads the files from the url

title: git reset
description: Clear the files from staging area

title: git pull
description: Fetch and integrate the repository to the local repository

title: git push origin
description: git push origin helps to push the commit to the local repository

title: git merge [branch_name]
description: This git command allows user to merge the current branch into the active branch.

title: git stash
description: This command temporarily stores all the modified tracked files.

title: git log follow[file]
description: This command lists version history for a file, including the renaming of files also.

title: git rm -r [file-name.txt]
description: The git remove command remove a file (or folder)

title: git mv
description: Move or rename a file, directory or symlink.

description: The git 'checkout -b' command creates a branch with the <branch_name> and also goes into it(checks in) the newly created branch.

title: git rm -r [file-name.txt]

title: git mv

title: git log
description: View the commits history.

title: git branch -d [branch_name]
description: The git branch -d command is used to delete a branch with the specified branch_name. Use -D instead of -d to force deletion, even if the branch contains unmerged changes.

title: git rebase [branch_name]:
description: The git rebase command allows you to reapply commits from one branch (specified by branch_name) onto another branch.

title: git remote -v
description: The git remote -v command shows a list of remote repositories along with their URLs in a more verbose format.

title: git show [commit_hash]
description: The git show command displays information about a specific commit, including the changes made in that commit.
